body: I am looking to start a youtube channel and need your help to suggest recording softwares with low CPU usage and little lag (for windows 7). I usually get around 40 to 50 fps when i play and it lowers when I record which makes it harder to PvP and rush. I need some help on finding recording softwares. Any Suggestions?? :D
body_tagged: I am looking to start a youtube channel and need your help to suggest recording softwares with low CPU usage and little lag (for windows 7). I usually get around 40 to 50 fps when i play and it lowers when I record which makes it harder to PvP and rush. I need some help on finding recording softwares. Any Suggestions?? :D
title: Recording Software for Windows 7

replies.body: Sorry homie can't help you.  I use Mac :P
replies.body_tagged: Sorry homie can't help you.  I use Mac :P

replies.body:
OBS is well-known, haven't tried it before though.

I would recommend Action: https://mirillis.com/en/products/action.html it's free with a watermark, the premium version removes the watermark, but you could probably crack it.
replies.body_tagged:
OBS is well-known, haven't tried it before though.

I would recommend Action: https://mirillis.com/en/products/action.html it's free with a watermark, the premium version removes the watermark, but you could probably crack it.

replies.body:
Just a small note.

I have used Action in the past and ran in quite a few problems with audio-video syncing and it actually recording audio.

I won't say "don't use it" but just a small note from my experience. Could still work for you though.

replies.body:
Fraps has a HUGE file size so dont go with that...
I would recommend DxTory or OBS both of them are great! :)
